answerText: Wolf-Rayet stars [accept WR stars][10] The collapse of a Wolf-Rayet star, known as a collapsar, is believed to cause the long version of this EM radiation's namesake "bursts," which were first discovered by the Vela 3 and 4 satellites. This radiation traditionally has shorter wavelengths than X-rays.
heading: Missiles of October |2011 | 1 | 7 | Science | Other | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Edwin Pickering discovered a namesake spectral series caused by helium that is emitted by these objects. For 10 points each: [10] Name these massive stars that lose a large amount of stellar matter due to intense stellar winds.
